intro: Microchilus vesiculosus, commonly known as the bubble cress, is a flowering plant native to Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes many other well-known plants such as cabbages and mustards. The plant is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and hairy, lobed leaves. It typically grows in moist, calcareous soils and is often found in grasslands and along stream banks. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release tiny, wind-dispersed seeds.
